headline: Southern Pecan Pie I
description: Lots of sugar, dark corn syrup and pecans come together with other delicious ingredients to create the quintessential pecan pie. Everything is stirred together in one bowl, poured into a prepared crust, and baked until this sweet pie is brown and slightly puffed.

video.description: See how to make a sweet and nutty pecan pie.
video.name: Southern Pecan Pie I

name: Southern Pecan Pie I
recipeIngredient: 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).
Beat eggs slightly in medium bowl. Beat in sugar, and then blend in syrup, butter or margarine, vanilla, salt, and pecans. Pour filling into unbaked pie shell.
Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and continue baking 35 to 40 minutes; the pie will be brown and slightly puffed.

review.reviewBody: Love this recipe !!!! I used Mrs Butterworths syrup and used jalapeño dusted pecans. It is a warm buttery delight!!!

This was a beautiful great tasting pie that most definitely didn't have me chasing it down with a large glass of water because of it being too sweet. The only changes that i made was i crushed my pecans, made my own crust and used light color Karo syrup.
This is my aunt and mother's recipe. I've made it plenty of times with Light Kayro Syrup because my son and dad loves them. I will be making another soon.
Great pecan pie recipe, I made it for Thanksgiving at my sisters. Luckily everyone was so full, there wasn't much ate and I got to bring home half of it. I loved it!
I used brown butter and toasted the pecans first. This was a big hit, I’ve been asked to make it for Thanksgiving dessert
Delicious
Make this constantly. Instant crowd pleaser.
Just awsome iv made 4, I did the dark and light Karo
Yes I’ve made it twice, 1st time was a little runny and second time was a little dry but got good remarks on both pies
This is the best pecan pie recipe I have ever made. It’s not too sweet and my entire family fights over it. I’ve become famous for my pecan pie since using this recipe! Thank you!
Made it with light syrup!! It was Dandy!! I wouldn’t change A thing!! Thx giving 2020
I followed the directions exactly! My pie looked gorgeous! But is was completely watery under the top layer...so disappointing

This recipe actually make two 9" regular pies or one 9" deep dish pie. I read that some say the pie did not set. You have to use small or medium eggs, any larger, the pie will not set. Also, do not over cook. I prefer my pie to be a medium brown, not dark brown.
Super easy to make and beyond delicious!
I have used this recipe for years. Every holiday my family expects me to make it. We all enjoy it very much.
Turned out great
This is a great pecan pie. recipe Next time I will use a deep dish pie crust.
I’ve made this pie at least 30 times and it’s always a hit. The only thing I tweak is that I add 1/2 teaspoon of maple flavoring. Perfect.
I've made this pie several times and it has always come out just right! Very easy and delicious!

The absolute best (and easiest) pecan pie ever! Shared with friends and they all raved about it. By the way, DO cover the edges of the crust with foil during the first half of the baking time. Came out perfect! Thanks Nikki!
Simple recipe with great results. Didn’t add the salt and used half light/dark corn syrup.

This was the first pecan pie I ever made. Everyone who had a piece said it was great and that this recipe is a keeper! I followed the recipe exactly except for using 1/2 light and 1/2 cup dark Karo syrup. I used medium eggs and let everything get to room temp as suggested by other reviews and it is perfect!
Delicious traditional pecan pie. My father in law said it tasted like the one his mom used to make. Will be my go to pecan pie recipe from now on.
Pecan pie
This is almost identical to my mother's recipe. Her recipe called for 2 tbs. of flour. Maybe that is why mine is not soupy.
This is the best on here, I should have used this one today but didn't have corn syrup. I am on my way to buy it now and make another pie. I tried another recipe and it came out terrible

As a Northerner, I was not raised on pecan pie. But after 34 years of being married to a Southern man, and being adept at making homemade pies with crust from scratch, my hubby finally asked me to make a pecan pie--my very first in 64 years. As suggested by a couple of others, I used half dark and half light Karo syrup. Husband said he "liked it a lot" and "the sweetness level was fine". Consistency was fine also, not soupy. This is all from hubby--I didn't partake--I prefer fruit pies.
Definitely a keeper! Used light and dark Karo. It was a family hit!!
Easy and perfect texture!
I don't use the salt or measure the vanilla and I have made this many, many times. My family and friends absolutely LOVE this recipe!!!
I have never made a pecan pie before . Everyone loved it. I used both dark and light corn syrup. Yummy!

I have been making this pie for years. A few changes like other bakers I used dark and light corn syrup. And a 1/4 cup less sugar. I also chopped my pecans and made the crust by hand. Took about 40 min. Was well worth it!!

This is the most simple, easy to make pie in the world. Because it is so simple, it is simply delicious!!! I use this recipe EVERY time I make Pecan Pie. I have requests for this pie, the recipe is so delicious!!! Try it! You won't be disappointed!!!!!
This is it! I did use a mix of dark and light corn syrup from others’ suggestions. It is quintessential southern pecan pie. It was so easy to make!

Super fast and easy to make pecan pie. I followed a few other reviewers and used half light and half dark syrup. I also used half brown sugar and half granulated sugar. This pie is so delicious that it’s going to be my go to pecan pie replacing my other more complicated pie recipe.

Super easy recipe to follow, but I had to reduce the amount of sugar. I try to eat healthy, but this recipe almost caused me to give up the healthy. :o) :o) :o) My family and friends have enjoyed this recipe and my pecan pie with less sugar. I am amazed at just how easy this is to make.
Left my recipe at home, so I tried this one. 2 pies and neither sat correctly. The filling was very runny. Will not use again.
My family loves this southern recipe, it is absolutely delicious! I make this at least 3 times a month, my family goes crazy over it!
The light & dark syrup was a hit! We served the pies at Thanksgiving and we no sooner had cut everyone a slice from all the offerings when one small sliver of pecan was left. Lots of happy guests. :)

I followed the directions to a T and, like some other reviewers, mine was all liquidy in the middle. It was pretty embarrassing when I cut into it in front of everyone at my Thanksgiving table and saw that it was a soupy mess in the middle. It tasted good but not a good presentation. Won't be making this recipe again. Feel like this recipe is missing a thickening agent like flour or cornstarch.

Don't have pecans, was thinking of using toasted walnuts instead, hope this works! I know typically an event like Thanksgiving isn't the time to experiment w a recipie, but when you already have what you have, ya go w it...
My family LOVES this pie!
4th year using this recipe, the babes love it!!
To keep it from being 'soupy', simply add 1 tablespoon of flour to get the filling to set...I also used 2 cups of whole pecans instead of 1.5....great standard recipe for pecan pie.

I don't like pecan pie but I made it for a funeral this week. My best friend's husband called and wanted to know why I had been keeping to myself all these years - it was the best pie he had ever had. It became 5 stars when I used 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar as well as 1/2 cup light Karo syrup and 1/2 cup dark Karo syrup. I even saw one guy pick up the pie tin and scrape the bottom. LOL! My husband and I think the secret is to keep cooking it until the center is completely jelled...no longer runny. Put aluminum foil around the pie shell edges so that does not burn.
Excellent! I make it using 1/2sugar & 1/2 splenda. NO ONE tastes the difference!
Wonderful recipe and easy
Loved it!

The pie tasted fantastic, but it was a little runny. Next time, I will read the reviews on a recipe before trying, as I see others have already said the same thing. This was my very first homemade pie, so I thought I had done something wrong.
I burned the crust and they still loved it!
Perfect!
Big hit and delicious!
I don't use dark mark syrul. I use the white mark syrup.
Amazing! I used dark and light corn syrup as suggested. I also made the mistake of not checking if I had pecans...walnuts were an amazing substitute. I will be making this again for sure!

I followed the recipe exactly. Unfortunately the pie did not set. Everyone said the flavor was great. It just needed to set. I did have to use large eggs because they had nothing smaller in the store. I was informed that it helps to get eggs up to room temperature first. I am going to try this again and perhaps take out a few table spoons of egg. Flavor fantastic, only issue was it not setting. I'll let you know how round two comes out!

How can anything that is so easy to make taste so good? I love this recipe. I also used 1/2 c. Light syrup and 1/2 c. Dark. I followed the recipe exactly as written and it was delicious. I love it , I will make this on all special occasions.
Best recipe I found it turned out so perfect my neighbor asked me to make one for her mom
I was told that it was the most delicious Pecan Pie my spouse ever tasted! The recipe was easy and foolproof. The only substitution I made was light brown sugar versus white sugar.
Easy to make and it turned out almost perfect the first time!! Not too sweet and great with cool whip!!
Delicious every time!

My favorite pecan pie recipe! Very good!! Make it every Thanksgiving and Christmas!
My only tip is don't mix too much and cover edges of pie crust so they don't over bake!!
This is a very easy recipe! I always use dark kayro syrup but this time I used the light syrup. My family loved the pies! Thanks for the easy recipe!
very good pecan pie! not too sweet! just right!
This was my first pecan pie attempt and it was scrumptious! The only change I made was I added more pecans and I toasted them first. Delicious and easy.

great recipe! i tried the half light, half dark syrup suggested in reviews. resulted in 'just right' sweetness. i used fresh pecans and chopped them. as in other reviews, when time is up, check for jiggle in the center. no jiggle, remove from oven. the times were good. would suggest covering the crust with strips of foil until the last 15 minutes. the pie came out wonderful!! will make this again!! UPDATE: first used regular pie crust and it was full! need steady hands! so i tried a deep pie crust and i am going to have to make adjustments....same times as recipe except : cover entire pie loosely and bake another 10-15 min. the times are good, but ovens are different, so just watch for the jiggle and cover if going over original time. will keep making until i run out of pecans in the yard!!!
Made this for Thanksgiving and it was the hit of the party! I was looking for a true southern pecan pie and this is it. Delicious!
Beautiful baked pies. I'll have to share the flavour after we eat today. Happy Thanksgiving!!!
So super easy and delicious! I made a homemade crust using flour, oil, milk, and salt.. exceptional!

Same recipe our Mom used for years until she was told to try using only 1/2 c. sugar instead of a cup.
It is was even better still plenty sweet but very delicious. Our family how makes it with only 1/2 cup sugar, as we decided we like it much better that way!~~~
Perfect recipe. Did not change a thing.
No changes to the recipe and my family loves it!!

Oh...my...goodness this pie takes me back to my southern roots. I love the authentic southern taste. One thing I did different is not Brown it at first. I baked it at 350 for 50 minutes. And let it cool as recipe suggested it was delicious will definitely make again and again. And i'll have to do an extra mile on my walking trail. Lol
I WILL make this again. Not too sweet! My husband doesn't like pecan pie but he had 3 pieces! A little whipped cream tops it off.
This was the first pie I've ever made (along with a pumpkin) and this recipe was so easy I couldn't believe it! Even my 6 year old liked it and she doesn't like anything!

I made this pie a cpl times to rave reviews, although it wasn't quite as good as my grandmother's (she was a pie master). 
I specifically recall her using brown sugar so I substituted brown sugar, but this made the pie just too sweet. I decided to use both, 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar and the result was a home run!!! I've seen other reviews doing this with the corn syrup.....I may try this in the future, but then again why fix something that isn't broken ??
In addition, I brown/warm the pecans (I add an extra 1/2 cup) in a skillet on the stove top until the natural oils are released. This makes the house smell wonderful and gives the pie a rich, nuttier flavor!!!
It's still not quite my grandmother's, but is equally as delicuous. Everyone raves over this pie and always wants the recipe!!!
I used only the light corn syrup an it was delicious. It wasn't so sweet as most of the recipes
Very simple and quick pie with good flavor. This is a sure favorite for Thanksgiving.
No changes excellent everyone loves this pie
My entire family loves this pie! I've made it for a couple of years now, and never had a complaint :)
I made a few tweaks, didn't have light or dark corn syrup, so I used 1/2 a cup of honey and 1/2 a cup of maple syrup and it turned out DELISH!!!!! Definitely would make it agian!!!

The pie came out AWESOME! I followed the directions to the letter. The only difference was, I left the pie in the oven after I turned it off. My granny always said it's better to let the pie cool in the oven. Then I took it out and let it rest for an hour or so. It's always a big hit at my church bake sale!
So in love with this Pecan Pie. It is a big hit in our family.

Oh my goodness! It was the greatest pecan pie I have ever made!!! LOL. It was the first pecan pie I have ever made and it was delicious. I am so glad that I run across this recipe. Thanks so much for sharing. Everyone loved it!!
After years of complaing about other people's pecan pie, I made this recipe. The wife said it was the best she ever had. Be prepared for over spill in store bought crusts.

I've never made pecan pie before, but I know what i like. And this recipe fit the bill very well. The consistency was perfect, and the flavor had just the right amount of sweetness. I will surely make it again.
I used light corn syrup and added 2 tablespoons of all purpose flour. It was delicious! Everybody loved it !!! A+
Used 1/2 cup of dark and 1/2 of light syrup and this was amazing :)
Soooo delicious, and very simple to make. I would recommend putting a foil strip on your crust for the first 20 minutes. Otherwise I stuck to the instructions and it turned out great.
This recipe is fantastic. I tweet it a bit adding 2 cups pecans instead of 1 and a half to make the pie more filling and 2 tablespoons bourbon! It's a household favorite around the holiday season!
Very easy and very good!
The taste is great but the filling is very soupy, even if you cook it longer.

This pie is gone within the hour in my house. It's so easy and not to sweet. I do half white sugar and half brown sugar and it turns out really good not gooey like some other people who have commented on here. I will continue to use this recipe for a long time
This is the perfect pecan pie. It's a hit every time I make it. Thanks for sharing!

Hubby wanted pecan pie for dessert on Easter, so I made this. I used 3/4 cup of dark corn syrup and 1/4 cup of light corn syrup. This pie was just as delicious as the pecan pie we had in South Carolina. And with a scoop of vanilla ice cream---it was even better !!! Excellent recipe
I cut sugar to 1/2 cup and used 1/2 cup light corn syrup and 1/2 cup maple pancake syrup. Got rave reviews at work with frequent requests to make it again.
My husband's favorite pie is pecan and this recipe was the first recipe I ever tried to make and he LOVES it!!
I never thought I would be able to make pecan pie until I found this recipe! OMG it is so amazing!!!!!!!
Didn't turn out as well as expected . . . The filling separated into a hard crunchy topping with a mushy filling underneath.
My first pecan pie and it was too easy & good!!! However I did have to increase the cooking time by about 30 mins. Other than that it was great!
